title: Unsupervised Deep Learning of Electronic Health Records to Characterize Heterogeneity Across Alzheimer Disease and Related Dementias: Cross-Sectional Study
details: M West, Y Cheng, Y He, Y Leng, C Magdamo… - JMIR Aging, 2025
abstract: Background: Alzheimer disease and related dementias (ADRD) exhibit prominent heterogeneity. Identifying clinically meaningful ADRD subtypes is essential for tailoring treatments to specific patient phenotypes. Objective: We aimed to use …

title: Llama-3-Meditron: An Open-Weight Suite of Medical LLMs Based on Llama-3.1
details: A Sallinen, AJ Solergibert, M Zhang, G Boyé… - … AI for Health at AAAI 2025, 2025
abstract: We introduce Llama-3-Meditron, a high-performing open-weight suite of medical large language models (LLMs) built on LLama-3.1 (8B and 70B). The models are pre- trained on a carefully curated medical corpus that includes textbooks, filtered …

title: Efficient multi-task learning with instance selection for biomedical NLP
details: A Bonfigli, L Bacco, L Pecchia, M Merone, F Dell'Orletta - Computers in Biology and …, 2025
abstract: Background: Biomedical natural language processing (NLP) increasingly relies on large language models and extensive datasets, presenting significant computational challenges. Methods: We propose Blue5, a multi-task model based on SciFive that …
